snippet: Regulators outlined a proposal that could make Internet service on airplanes cheaper, at speeds up to 30 times faster than the service many people have in their homes.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission proposes auctioning off rights to use newly available airwaves to provide better in-flight Wi-Fi connections, part of agency's effort to improve speed and lower cost of Internet service on commercial flights.
lead_paragraph: Regulators outlined a proposal that could make Internet service on airplanes cheaper, at speeds up to 30 times faster than the service many people have in their homes.

headline.seo: F.C.C. Advances Plan for Faster In-Flight Wi-Fi
headline.main: F.C.C. Advances Plan for Faster In-Flight Wi-Fi
headline.print_headline: To Keep Fliers Connected, F.C.C. Advances a Plan to Speed Up Wi-Fi on Jets
